questions.text: How would you describe the steepness of your usual travel routes?
How would you describe the condition of the walking/cycling paths you usually use?

options.text: Very poor — rough and difficult to walk or cycle on
Poor — many holes or damaged areas
Fair — some bumps or cracks here and there
Good — mostly smooth, a few small rough spots
Very good — smooth and well maintained

questions.text: How adequate is street lighting along your routes?

options.text: Very poor — mostly dark or no lights

questions.text: How would you rate the cleanliness and maintenance of the public areas along your usual routes?

options.text: Very poor — very dirty or badly maintained
Poor — often dirty or not maintained
Fair — some litter or things need repair
Good — mostly clean, minor issues sometimes
Very good — clean and well maintained

questions.text: How often do you see or pass by green spaces (parks, gardens, trees) along your routes?

options.text: Never — no green spaces at all
Rarely — only in a few spots
Often — on many parts of my route

questions.text: Are there enough benches or places to rest along your usual routes?

options.text: Yes, plenty of places to rest

questions.text: How well connected are the walking and cycling paths in your area?

options.text: Very poor — paths don’t connect at all
Poor — many breaks in the paths
Good — mostly connected, a few gaps
Very good — paths join up everywhere

questions.text: How would you describe the noise levels along your usual routes?

options.text: Very noisy — hard to relax or concentrate
Quite noisy — often loud or disturbing
Mostly quiet — some noise, not disturbing

questions.text: How busy was the traffic on the routes you take?
How would you describe your comfort level from road traffic while walking?
How would you describe your comfort level from crime while walking?
How would you describe your comfort level in areas with poor lighting while walking?
How would you describe your comfort level regarding harassment while walking?
During your trip, did you encounter any physical barriers, like stairs or curbs, that made walking difficult?
If you answered Yes earlier, how difficult did these barriers make your walking?
While walking, how often did you come across shaded areas?

options.text: I didn’t see any shaded areas

questions.text: Was the trip longer or shorter than you expected?
How tired do you feel after this trip?
During your trip, how often did you feel anxious, insecure, or overwhelmed?
During your trip, did you feel uncomfortable in your body (for example, from heat, tiredness, or pain)?

options.text: Extremely – I felt very uncomfortable most of the time
A lot – I often felt uncomfortable
A little – I had some minor discomfort
Not at all – I felt comfortable the whole time

questions.text: Compared to other ways you usually travel, how hard or easy was this one?
During your trip, how did the weather (like temperature or rain) affect your experience?

options.text: It made things a little harder/uncomfortable
It made things a little easier/enjoyable

questions.text: How satisfied were you with your travel on this trip?
Would you take this same trip again in the future?
What would make you want to take this trip again?

options.text: Social reasons (meeting others, traveling with family or friends)
Safety and security along the route

questions.text: What changes would make you more likely to repeat this trip?

options.text: Improved safety from road traffic or crime
Improved access to public transport connections
Lower travel costs (e.g., cheaper public transport, parking)
Easier navigation (clearer signs, apps, route maps)

questions.text: What factors would discourage you from repeating this trip?

options.text: Lack of safety (road traffic, crime, harassment)
Lack of shade or rest areas

questions.text: Would you consider using a different mode of transport for the same trip if certain conditions were improved? (Examples: better public transport options, safer bike lanes, reduced travel time, lower costs, improved comfort)
If yes, which mode would you prefer?
